allowed anie christian generall councel lateran councell gathered name antichrist maintaine pride abominable heresy neither hath anie one learned doctor 500 600 yeares christ liked allowed confession according popish definition thereof much lesse christian people reuerently frequented lest al confession onelie refuge meane confession alwaies priest christian relapse absurd proposition thinke learned papistes maintaine sure manie elder papist haue denied holding contrition heart men might obtaine remission sinnes without confession mouth priest wherfore seeth impudent brag set vpon false matter wherein seeth neither christ institution word example antiquitie anie credible report practise christian people necessary ground 〈◊〉 learned witnes reason necessarie conclusion vphold maintaine let schoole conscience according holie scripture nothing mooued vaine glosing shameles boaster allen vpon consideration practise approoued meanes possible charge selfe obedience trueth exercise lise workes seeth moste sure certaine well church vsage god owne writing moe word weigh persuasion man shall euer much mooue continuall terrour conscience alwaies acknowledging truth minde practise wherof outward fact abhorreth effectualliie force vnto hard seemeth knowe wordlinges weake hard neuer man could haue brought church much lesse haue continued long proceeded precept christes owne mouth open whole heart minde man ioyned naturall bashfullnes frailtie vtter selfe sort sinne euer moste filthie lothsome knowing feeling vndoubtedlie continuall close keeping thereof court conscience much great greeuose torment therwith concerning christes ordinance consideration imbecillitle contrarie liking phantasie maie ought withdrawe v thing v accounttd moste conuenient necessarie let v neuer disobedient willes striue god wisedome fvlke shewe god owne writing popish shriftis necessarie good conscience runne faste vnto despise abhorre confession holie writinges god doe require christian wilbe readie make confession mortall sinnes tearme necessitie made man finde scripture doth charge conscience saie earthly power could haue established begun burthenous thing shrift agree yet followeth force christes institution hath driuen worlde thereunto subtiltie deuill hath preuailed deceiue mindes ignorant men 2 thess 2 earthlie power knowledge could haue preuailed yea god himselfe hath sent efficacy error worlde antichrist whose tiranie nothing burthenous might preuaile deceiuing reprobate punishment 〈◊〉 haue embraced knowledge trueth saluation might beleeue lie condemnation wherefore let man maruell antichrist hath laied many heauie intollerable burthen vpon men conscience earthlie power could bring passe comming foreshewed according effectuall workeing satan power signes wonder lie deceitfullnes vnrighteousnes perish neither let man blinded foolish sophistrie inconsequence allen neuer earthlie power could haue established begunne anie burthenous thing popish shrift therefore hath force christes constitution ordinance whereof worde brought hol e scripture allen hurthen therefore confession seeme man intollerable deede verie pleasant haue tasted sweete christ let ease earnest consideration exceeding commodious breake pride man heart make know himselfe burthen shamefastenesse appeare vttering sinnes may learne take gladlie worthie paine offence peece gladlie fall composition sinnes seemeth easie enough especiallie since euerie man litle monie may choose confessour according owne conceite whose lappe may vomit burthen seared conscience assured vita mutanda per eleemosinas de peccatis praeteritis est propitiandus deus non ad hoc emendus quodam modo vt ea semper liceat impunè committere nemini enim dedit laxamentum peccandi quamuis miserando deleatiam facta peccata si non satisfactio congrua negligatur de quotidianis autem breuibus leuibusque peccatis sine quibus haec vita non ducitur quotidiana oratio fidelium satis facit eorum est enim dicere pater noster qui e coelis quiiam patri talus regenerati sunt ex aqua spiritu sancto delet omninò haec oratio minimum quotidiana peccata delet illa à quibus vita fidelium sceleratè etiam gesta sed poenitendo melius mutata discedit si quemadmodum veraciter dicitur demitte nobis debita nostra quoniam non desunt quae dimittantur ita veraciter dicatur sicut no dimittimus debitorib nostris id est fiat quod dicitur quia ipsa eleemosyna est veniam petenti homini ignoscere suerlie must take heede lest anie man thinke wicked crimer committe shall possesse kingdome god dailie committed dailie que peccati actione autem poenitentiae vbitae lecrimen commissum est vt qui commisit christi etiam corpore separetur nōtam consideranda est mensura temporis quàm doloris cor enim contritum humiliatum deus non spernit verùm quia pierunque dolor • lterius cordis occultus est alteri neque aliorum notitiam per verba vel quaecunque alia signa procedit cùm sit coram illo cui dicitur gemitus meus à le executer law penance appointed inferiour priest confession may likewise remit prescribed inferiour may good reason vpon consideration altered superiour especiallie magistrate hath good meanes prouide neither common wealth suffer damage thereby partiē whome doth perteine loosed bounde penance receiue losse thereby like authoritie also doth pardon change sometimes sharper longer paine enioyned gentle penance fit needeful workes time state beeing power chiefe gouernour may exceeding benefi ciall worlde case euer ought practized edifying neuer destruction considered high pastour vsualite graunieth release debt good workes bond deserued punishment prescription holie worke accomplished partie obteine benefit remission 〈◊〉 penitent hath enioyned punish bodie continual fasting long peregrination exceeding much temporall pain according grieuousnes desertes freedome pardon tentimes turneth saide due paine enioyned easier worke christian charitie yet beeing much glory god receiued greater mercie gaue forth great token therof loue cause pardon forgiuenes sinnes manie sinnes forgiuen therefore shee loued much shee greater cause whome litle forgiuen ioueth litle manifest omnem praese fert misericordiam nam ne peccantes inulti manentes no efficeremur deteriores non remisit nobis supplicium sed vidit hoc manifestè quòd peccatis ipsis non minus damnosum sit non puniri propter hoc imponit poenam non exigens supplicium de peccatis sed ad futura no corrigent et vt discas quod hoc sit verum audi quid dicatad mosem dimite iratus delebeos dimitte non quod moseseum retinuerit ne que enim loquutus erat ad eum sed silenter astabat sua pro illis oratione non autem supplicacionem ei dare vo lebat quonamilli digna suppliciis comiserant suppliciisque ineuitabilibus punire autem volebat sed miserecorditer quod eos segniores reddebat vira que autem fecit v paenam non inferres neque illos faceret ignauiores paena non irrogata discebant n quod non sue merito sed remittit qui punire vult tuncenim irascimur ipse autem dicit dimitte irascar vt scias quodirain deo non sit affectio sed pana no eo vocabulo nominetur quando igitur audis mosem dicentem siquidem dimittis pecceatum dimitte prae seruo dominum obstupesee quod ipse fibi ipsi miserecordiae occasionem quaerit non hîc autem solum hoc fecit sed ad ieremiam ad ezechielem idem hoc dicit circuite videte vitious vnder gospell euer vnder popedome praie master frarine saith luther much professed gospell preached hypocrits whose wickednes grea ter knowledge receiued thē ignorance thé truth luther neither flattereth vngodlie wardlie professed gospell yet accuseth al true professours wickednes hypocrite doth luther testimonie make frarines slaunder accuse papist worst men worlde anyof disciple england sigismonde king pole seuerall edict publike writing though bounde inuincible chaines argument asketh laie witness though easiest thing worlde answere though noblest best worthiest credit time yet far distant place liued eie witness naughty behauiour therfore whatsoeuer write must needes proceede false suggestion enemy otherwise credible duke saxonie vnder luther liued known vile person would haue suffered liue much le would haue reformed religion according preaching luther thus summoned appeare taketh vpon pythonesse plaied samuell call vp caluine hell confesse kept nunne fiue countrie parent friendes departed wife vnto geneua selling benefice vnhonest manner mention contrariwise preface defieth world crime dishonestie setting forth certaine wanton verse made child printed vnder age twentie yeares second crime obiected maried man wife tailor dwelling harpe street paris whome master charkes censurer bolsec affirmeth haue dwelt calender street maie know wel witness agree togither slaunderrs shee called beza mistres candidae mistres bewtie bawdie verse whereas well knowne beza poeticall fiction deuised imitation auncient poet meant special person least could meane wife verse commendeth candidae great childe god whereas wife neuer anie childe saith shee fled stewes husband hauing taken adultery giuen gash knife hippe pretie inuention gash bene face anie part bodie might haue bene seene honestie haue beene witnes scarre therefore placed none shame might demaund sight triall cause flight vnto stewes saith bene put prison fetched friscoll dawnsing tauerne customer said hoigh one leape christian soules sorie cause flie comme stewes shee beene imprisoned like thing beene shee beene willing depart husband shee hauing many customer tale pretendeth specially beza could spend seuen hundred crownes yeare confesseth would haue sought aid rather haue cast selfe place publike infamie fable vtterlie denied beza containing sparke trueth wife maried priuilie paris presence one two onelie friendes godlie honest behauionr would consent match vpon expresse promise condition assone could conuenientlie al impediment set asside carie church god openlie confirme matrimonie betweene also meane time enter none popish order condition faithfullie performed isnothing therefore brought beza vertuous wife accusation without witnes slaunders without proofe lie without colour shew trueth like saie generall railing followeth schollers gospellish congregation scornefullie termeth mistres whose wickednes kinde horrible sinnes affirmeth great lot bin betweene protestantes papist order iustice wisheth bin obserued whether haue wickedly trāsgressed god man law haue gone first gallowes beene one protestant left aliue holde warre papist ashamed vse wordes confutation monstrous lie eninmie protestantes right wittes doth thinke conscience bere credit similitude trueth many called protestantes haue beene wicked liuers condemned capitall crime beyond moste wicked papist beyond measure moste pestilent yet riduculous slaunder yow saith man faultes owne subscribe crime law ordeineth binde selues punishment fault could prooue yes verelie either generall crime heresy laide antichrist sinagogue particular crime person many papist reachers learning professe many professours also haue put name subscribed owne handes although failed proofe beene heard indifferent iudges yet haue beene cruellie tormented put death testimonie trueth whereas frarine haue beene bounde ordinance law prescribeth others many liues hydra fained haue heades bodie would haue sufficed execution hath deserued particular slaunders men last generall accusation protestantes yet impudentlie behaued selues contrarie order forme lawfull proceeding monstrous iudgement reformation accuser witness iudges hang men yourselues howe much rightlie might haue vttered pope beeing accused heresie blasphemie would owne iudge tried witnes butof owne allowing wheras protestantes neuer refused arbitriment free lawful councel auncient remedie decide controuersies church word god highest iudge conuocation men haue power define thing maie saith frarine vow chastitie suffred break mariage calleth bathing body stinking pudle carnall pleasure cause vprores vnfitlie quarrell vowes alledged caluine beza principall teacher french nation neuer made vow wise men maie laugh consider yet followeth matter verie whotlie saith faith promise mortall enemie kept much made almightie god would eloquent orator beene aliue time councell constance might haue persuaded popish church haue kept publike faith safe conduite graunted hus hierome shamefullie violated vnder colour faith kept heretikes time slaughter varni drew destruction noble realme hungarie might haue diswaded pope able conteine kept marrying rather dailie broken burning remedie whereof iudgement epiphanius saint hierom catholike church time mariage common stewes brothell house light woman maried vnmaried nun fallen profession frarine doth leaue vnto lesse euell mariage common stewes brothel howses saith open time euerie men pleasure shewed vnder christian prince magistrate manteine doctrine gospell verilie poperie reigneth pope setreth himselfe rome maruell though grosse impietie onely suffered vnpunished also pope proctor desended conuenient yet townes well ordered votary suffered haue misteris harding contra apoligiam candida vessell easement saith couerdales phrase yet sheweth place demaundeth whether sufficient quarrell bidde battaile manteine kingdom gospell venus euerie place chast religious phrase carpeth couerdales phrase whome perhappes belieth sence meaneth answer cause beene greatlie addict ladie lecherie faineth well ordered townes manie poperie might much ease haue remooued cyties greater licence haue taken hand indured great dangerous warres satisfying lust without regard conscience beene marke shot needed haue bound themselues one woman mariage bringeth manie care trouble might without controllement haue change choice confesse common stewes euerie euen cloying carnall lust continued still poperie yet searching cause warres taken hand obiecteth 1 tim 5 side wealthes doctrine publike autoritie hath long time bene receiued meete saith could freelie preach worde therefore laie hand sworde apostle went suffer strike master minister word verie hard speake gunnestones preach fire powlder ride preach barbed horse put corpsiet faith iron al proceeding teaching contrarie christ doctrine wise man may laugh vaine rhetorike hath sene hard modest christianlike behauiour preacher speake nothing doctrine yea christ saith content ride asse apostle goe barefot planting gospell whereon 〈◊〉 pope cardinal feete surbaighted going barefote preach gospell although knowe findeth holie scripture apostle went barefote planting gospell trauell great partes world though bene well shood yea booted ridden horsebacke comparison made minister gospell antichrist pope proud prelate whether pacience humility mildnes behauiour like christ apostels doubt cause though triall verie partiall iudges well howsoeuer haue suffered martyrdome rather haue resisted murthered would sought liue licentiouslie hope eternall life among manie thousand suffered martyrdome quietlie without resistance imprisoned tormented condemned power kil body finde example pacience hope eternall life except protestant world giue throtes cut suffer themselues murthered contrarie lawe liberty established lawfull authoritie priuat persones bloodie tirants poore christian duke guyse vassi rest fraunce haue beene god stirred vp diuers prince noble men request queene mother oppose themselues furious trayterous attempt bloodie tyrant abusing minoritie king whome toke captiue mother himselfe paterne patience saide seruant moste iniuriouslie smote stoode iudgement high priest smitest thou haue spoken euill beare witnes euill deale order iustice requireth saint paule faithfull disciple could forbeare painted wall ananias pretending sit iudgement according lawe contrarie lawe commaund smitten protestant fraunce hauing authoritie power defend themselues suffer duke guyse priuate man straunger complices smite heades one stroke rather oppose themselues furie onelie defence gospell also maintenance lawe libertie nation resistance therefore treason rebellion crueltie cloysters filthilie abuse still speaketh though none author captaines souldiers warres licentious minister though manie prince noble men gentleman valiant souldiers serued warres quarrell maintaine vnderstood according saying sauiour christ seeing men neuer agree imbrace word god wished many men would contend impugners al men agree withstand luther charged haue set view wholl worlde seditious seeing possible monster faineth haue beene much fauoured cherished prince estate luther neuerthelesse shall heare proofes first wicelius luther enemie reporteth saied men wash handes bloode romish cleargie reporte true prooueth former accusation allbeit popish cleargie slaine lawfull authoritie detestation blasphemie idolatry gouernment church common wealth neuer decay bound beleue wicelius fiction neuer writte anie epistle taught anie doctrine cleane contrarie necessitie magistrate al christian common wealth secondlie chargeth haue written lib de potest seculari men ought pray god vplandish men obey prince goe warre turke title booke finde workes sure matter conteined anie booke title soeuer contrariwise writeth many treatise rebellious bowres verie earnestlie condemning disobedience sedition thirdlie quoteth lib contr duo edict caesaris men shoulde contribute nothing towardes charge warres turke malitiouslie construed though denied tribute emperour whereas commendeth iudgemét slate germany emperour would yelde nothing requestes libertie religion denied graunt subsidie contribution required vnder pretence resist turke purpose seemes rather bent french king perhaps euen whose monie defireth giuen warneth also attempt rashly warre vpon turke councell moderation doth farre excell prince liuing might hope victory forthlie noteth lib de bello contra turcam luther assert artic 24 lawfull christian men warre turke whosoeuer fight turke fought god punishment whereas luther meaning anie writing christian vnder turkes dominion free libertie religion rebell although otherwise grieuouslie oppressed last alledgeth booke de 〈◊〉 babil neither man angell anie authoritie make anie law one syllable whereunto christian men bound obey longer pleaseth said luther free thinges could hope reformation except lawes men abolished gospell libertie 〈◊〉 home much like effect whereupon fowler wise man con cludeth margent luther chiefe preacher gospell would haue beene king alone selfe pardoxes sprang rebellion muntzer boores good god shame haue papistes slaundering luther booke speaketh spirituall freedome conscience christ hath purchased v ought entangled anie tradition preceptes men ciuill lawes ordinance writeth one sillable whereas false prophet traitor muntzer boasted fight lordes battells frarine calleth melancthon witnes luther affirmed namelie god selfe rise stand estate germanie tyrannie doubteth wicked soeuer attempt doings seditious person god vsed scourge punish sinnes ruler luther prophecied victorie rebells fable manie others frarine reporteth contrar iwise writing threatneth destruction bodie soule except gaue ouer diuelish enterprices discourse muntzerian rebelles commeth luther marriage nunne inueigheth two respectes first time immediatlie calamitie germanie person nunne stolne eight others nunnerie nimike vppon good frydaie bawde leonard knoppen time shee broken wanton toy lecherous recreation space two yeares among schollers wittenberg yea luther tooke scorne daunse drinke carouse cand verie penance sorow mischiefes whereof himselfe author though manie men misliked luther mariage nunne perhaps rather confirme owne act libertie matrimonie made rash vow able performe yet wise man hope beleeueth made better choise frarine affirmeth light behauiour daunse drinke carouse slaunders proofe brought frarines bare affirmation whose bould lying el dogged scorning let indifferent men iudge credit deserueth whereas luther write vehe mently seditious boores impudent slaunders frarine manifest conuicted faineth protestation state sufficientlie declare satisfie pope crueltie oppresse libertie ger many frarine maketh great matter resistance saying germanie haue obeyed beck though king spaine made emperor almaine defence germanie according auncient priueliges liberty thereof vtter ouerthrough destruction victorie pleaseth frarine well cause displease v seing pleased god punish securitie germanie shew vaine trust strength men albeit charles caried victorie cleare keepeth couenantes conquered law armes deteined lantgrane prisoner owne accord came vnto entreat agreement vniust dealing prouoked euen whome aduaunced seeke reuenge falsehood duke moris saxonie marque brandenburg meanes susteined ignomine end euer gat glorie beginning warres frarine thinke necessarie germanie emperours beck case whie perswade louanians popish state lowe country obedient beck commaundements spanish king sufferaigne king spaines sufferaignetie absolute limited within compasse certaine condition bound obey let doubt germanie hath better ground doings young oratours louane haue witte controll warre heluetians wonder see termeth sedition insurrection stirred vp zuinglius whereas certaine fiue cantones popish faction intollerable iniurie prouoked zurek berne lawfull warres whose cause bene neuer vniust yet might termed insurrection state themselues ought obedience rebellion wiat practises kill queene marie neuer allowed teacher gospell england knookes booke misliked forbidden solde euen geneua put print pope head popish faction hath onelie 〈◊〉 vp rebellion moste honourable prince europe queene elizabeth hebellion north england also hath sent standard souldiers inuade dominion ireland omitt traiterous writing saunder bristow vile beastlie bull pius fiste saide moste noble soueraigne confirmed hypocrite sitteth chayre pestilence rome faculty graunted parsones campiane licenseth papist dissemble obedience vntill publike execution bull maie priuie traitours till hope successe maie open rebells scottish queenes behauiour hath much dishonoured person frarine pardoned spake thing praise vttermost reproch made manifest worlde rebellion gentleman sueuia common denmarke passe ouer frarine doth seing vnlawfull religion alloweth vpon iust cause sufficient authoritie vniustlie called rebellion vprore cannot omitt late treason cruell conspiracie hugonites fraunce whereof caluin dictatour generall beza lieuetenant othomannus spisamius petie captaines whoe refraine laughing heare pleasant deuises least thinke iested saith chiese doer indeed though vsed name seruice certaine nobilitie beare brunte whilest slept knaues stocke trumping cardes pesantes maketh prince nobleman tooke armes deliuer king mother captiuitie lawe oppression subiects cruell murther tyrannie yet confesseth tragedie peaceable beginning gat lawe force extorsion saith king magistrate pleasure marke probablie speaketh lawe made whereunto none gaue assent authoritie make lawe consent enforced parliament paris made answere first cannot ought afterward compelled let bill passe edict ianuarie made force extorsion compulsion alledged elude authoritie lawe person meanes manner shewed one word indeed vnpossible shewed neuer truth edict made consent three estate fraunce time peace much feare suspition warre policie maintaine peace auoide trouble might insue thorough controuersie religion quiet peaceable behauiour protestantes conference poysie notorious oratour able denie saieth dissembled might easilie obtaine lawevnder shadowe whereof might banish lawe religion world roote ciuill order reporte one made chaine priestes care crueltie required church geneua receiued yet followeth killed priestes whose eares cut neuertheles confesse although discipline warre well looked vnto state thinges could yet manie thing done vnrulie soldier neither captaines preacher could thinke well anie fled orleans carrie newes enemy hardlie dealt lesse maruaile seing within citie keeping themselues
